page.title: 07The Cattle Mart.
page.content: The cattle mart is held every Friday morning in Elgin. At the mart, people come from farms all over the Elgin and Birnie area to buy and sell cattle. Mostly young heifers are bought at the mart. There is a small ring where the cows are paraded around so that the buyers have a good look at them. The auctioneer keeps up a constant babble of numbers which only the farmers seem able to understand. Farmers make their bids by winking or raising a finger. With every bid the auctioneer increases the price until there are no more bids and he bangs a piece of wood onto his desk. Later the cows are loaded onto lorries and taken to their new farms.
